title: How to Turn on Backlit Keyboard on Lenovo

steps.title: Turn on your laptop.
steps.content: Turn on your laptop. In some cases, your backlight may not turn on due to low battery. Make sure your laptop is charged to at least 75%. If your battery is an issue, there are ways to increase your battery longevity.

steps.title: Locate the Backlight shortcut key.
steps.content: Locate the Backlight shortcut key. In most cases, this will be located on your keyboard's Spacebar. [1] X Research source The icon looks like a horizontal bracket with arcing rays above it.

steps.title: Press Fn+Backlight to turn on your keyboard backlight.
steps.content: Press Fn + Backlight to turn on your keyboard backlight. Fn is the abbreviation of Function . [2] X Research source Similar to taking screenshots on Lenovo , you'll need to press these keys at the same time. To adjust your brightness, press Fn and Backlight as many times as needed to cycle through your laptop's brightness presets. To turn off your backlight, press Fn and Backlight until the backlight turns off.

steps.title: Turn on your laptop.
steps.content: Turn on your laptop. Make sure your laptop is charged.

steps.title: Locate the ThinkLight shortcut key.
steps.content: Locate the ThinkLight shortcut key. In most cases, this will be located on your keyboard's Page Up button. This is abbreviated as PgUp on your keyboard. [3] X Research source The icon looks like a half circle with rays extending below it.

steps.title: Press Fn+ThinkLight at the same time.
steps.content: Press Fn + ThinkLight at the same time. Fn is the abbreviation of Function . Your ThinkLight should turn on. [4] X Research source To turn ThinkLight off, press Fn and Page Up together again.

steps.title: Check Lenovo Vantage.
steps.content: Check Lenovo Vantage. This is a built-in application that helps your Lenovo device run properly. [5] X Research source Open your task bar and search for Lenovo Vantage . Click Device, Input & accessories . Confirm Keyboard backlight is activated.

steps.title: Power drain the built-in battery.
steps.content: Power drain the built-in battery. Newer laptops will have a built-in battery. [6] X Research source Unplug the AC adapter. Press and hold your device's Power button for 10 seconds. Reconnect the AC adapter and turn the device on.

steps.title: Power drain the detachable battery.
steps.content: Power drain the detachable battery. Older laptops will have a detachable battery. [7] X Research source Unplug the AC adapter. Press and hold your device's Power button for 10 seconds. Install the battery, reconnect the AC adapter, and turn the device on.
